text: hey guys it's Elise and welcome back to
my cupcake addiction today I'm going to
show you how to make some really really
simple and really fun Barbie themed
cupcakes and they even come with
printable cupcake wrappers all you need
to do is cut them out size them up to
your cupcake and sticky tape them on the
back I've got some melted black candy
melts but you could also use something
like cookie icing or royal icing I've
also got a template that you guys will
need to print so I'm going to leave a
link to that in the description box down
below you'll need a piece of waxed paper
or parchment paper something that you
can see through for tracing and a ziploc
bag you're also going to need a spoon a
pair of scissors and I've got some of
our perfectly pipeable buttercream
frosting I've tinted it pink and I've
got it in a disposable piping bag with a
nice big round open piping tip let get
started so the first thing you want to
do is you want to pour your candy melts
into a ziplock bag and then you want to
push them all the way down to the corner
and let any air out of that bag you're
going to snip a very very fine little
tip and then we're going to trace around
the template so I like to start at the
tip of the pony tail and make sure that
your candy melts are really nice and
melted here because you don't want them
to be starting to thicken up we're going
to find it kind of hard to pipe I like
to do the outline of my Barbie head
before I go back and fill it in just to
make sure that it's all contained within
a nice neat outer lining once you've put
your little outline all done if you're
really careful not to drag the excess

up in my hand like that so I don't have

just going to come and fill in my little
outline once you've filled in your
little Barbie with the candy melt
without actually squeezing or notice I
just use the tip of my bag to kind of
just swirl that candy metal around
because I know we're going to flip these
I want to make sure that there is
definitely no little spots on the
opposite side where there's gonna be any

are going to be quite fragile so handle
with care and maybe
make a couple of spares fabulous so with
all of those now parked you want to let

them in the refrigerator but you can
just set them at room temperature so
once all of your little pieces are set
it's sometimes good to take like a nice
flat knife and just slide it right
underneath your little template just to

handle them here because they're going
to be pretty pretty fragile we're going

now you want to take your little Barbie
and you want to line her up so she's
nice and level with the little Barbie on
the front of your cupcake wrapper
there's your first little Barbie cupcake
now I'm going to do that on two of my
cupcakes and then for the third I'm
going to do a flat top frosting style
you want to pop your cupcake out of that

this is getting to be kind of like a

to be a really nice flat surface to
